reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the Ritz and have stayed at many in the past this was a typical Ritz Carlton good service nice people staying at the hotel. The rooms were slightly dated but found a room that was suitable eventually. Pool was great as were the loungers and views. Club lounge was also good.
reviews.title: Ok Beware of the Saturday parties

reviews.text: Now on to the Saturday, I was told I needed a stamp as they were having a party to go to the pool. I said to them no way I was paying $600 a day to stay at the hotel. The next thing people covered in tattoos and looking like pimps turned up to party as they have a pool party. This was a total shock I stay at the Ritz for luxury and this was like a teenage party. This was last year I hope they have stopped this now as I really feel this reflects on their brand. The Ritz should=Luxury..
reviews.title: Classy Hotel with a warm feel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It's a little off the touristy beaten path. I took my 8yr old twin girls to LA & Hollywood for their MidWinter Vacation. The Hotel itself was the biggest attraction. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and everything was perfect.
reviews.title: I've stayed in better . . .

reviews.text: . . . hotels and for way less $$!
reviews.title: Very Very nice property

reviews.text: Sure the location is fine if you are into boating or yachting however for the money, I'm thinking that LA must have better hotels for less $$!
reviews.title: Too Many Add-ons

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Marina del Rey in October 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed my trip. The location of the hotel is right on the marina and beautiful. For a little bit more we stayed on a club level which is an absolute must. Food and drinks all day are included on this level. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs was delicious. Great service from employees and staff!!
reviews.title: Great service and attention! Beautiful location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel! Great Service! Great Food! Great view! Great Experience! My husband and I came back this time for our 1 year anniversary. The last time having been our wedding night last year. The service was as excellent as always and the staff makes you feel very welcomed without being too nosy. They even had a card for us for our first anniversary to welcome us and I don't remember telling them that it was our anniversary. It made us feel very special even though we are not "special people" if you know what I mean. The hotel interior has that classic feel to it, but the lounge at night, the pool, and the outdoor view make it feel very romantic. Pool is very nice. Bedding and mattress very good quality. Would stay here again if had the chance.
reviews.title: Second time back and would come again in a heartbeat

reviews.text: You expect everything to go perfectly at a Ritz, and my recent stay was anything but. A very curt / cold check-in process, and at the bar, the bartender took all the time to slowly unload the dishwasher and gab it up with another patron, completely ignoring others waiting. In the hotel room on arrival, linens in the bathroom were disheveled as if the bathroom had been used before my arrival, and on the second day, soiled linens were left on the bed stand. Both telephones in the room either had very poor sound quality or were completely disfunctional. I asked for them to be replaced during the day while I was away, and on returning, had the same problems with the telephones. An engineer actually came to my room to replace the phones, and had the same problems with the aged replacement phones he brought. The walls are paper thin - I heard my room neighbors taking things out of their closets, using the sink, shower, toilet, etc. - and couldn't get a restful night of sleep. All in all, I really felt the trip was more befitting of a 2 or 3 star hotel, not a 5 star hotel - very disappointing.
reviews.title: Falls WAY Short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an absolutely splendid place to stay. My boyfriend and I came here to spend some time at the beach and have a romantic getaway to celebrate his birthday. The service was impeccable - we were offered a room upgrade upon our check-in in honor of my boyfriend's birthday, and we were shown to a small but plush room with a balcony. We had a breathtaking view of the Marina del Rey harbor and the ocean beyond. Room service later sent up some complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries as yet another birthday gift.
reviews.title: Romantic Getaway

reviews.text: We spent some time in the pool/jacuzzi area, both of which gave the feeling of being in a remote island resort. The landscaping is lovely. The outdoor bar near the pool was closed due to the weather, which was disappointing; I'm sure that's a fun addition.
reviews.title: There are much better places to stay in LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and I stayed here after I had a great stay at a Ritz in Orlando, This hotel was like a baby sister compared to the Orlando Ritz. Only valet parking was available for $30+ but literally across the street there was a lot for approximately $15 so we parked there every night. We were woken by our room neighbors @ 7:30am by the noise of there, what sounded like painful sex... but it only lasted 1.5 mins...2 tops...hehe. We enjoyed our breakfast at the Jer-ne restaurant - usual hotel breakfast fare, the servers were great!
reviews.title: ritz feel- loud obnoxious neighbours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our second night we received chocolate covered strawberries and a card signed by the entire staff, because upon checkin i had mentioned we were there celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary... I was such a nice touch. Again the next morning we were woken by the sounds of our neighbors. I would suggest requesting a quiet corner of the hotel so that you do not have to hear anyone else's noise... but then can make all the noise you want! We had a great view of the marina, it was picture perfect. I would stay here again, but like I said request a room with no neighbors.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in LA

reviews.text: My husband and I checked into the Marina Del Rey for a 5 night stay for our honeymoon. The valet staff were super friendly upon our arrival and helped us with our luggage. The desk staff said they had been waiting for us and offered their congratulations on our recent marriage which was a nice touch. We were shown to our room which was on the concierge level of the hotel (11th floor, room 1111) . There was a surprise from one of our friends when we arrived in the room. A beautiful spread of chocolate covered strawberries with the message congratulations. They were super yummy and they brought another round after we had been there an hour.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.text: The rooms are done in neutral tones that I think most people would enjoy. Our room featured a balcony which offered a great view of the Marina and surrounding areas. The pool looked great as did the hot tub area. We didn't use these on our trip as is was cool. I did use the gym however, which featured basic cardio equipment as well as free weights and nautilus equipment. The locker rooms are gorgeous and offer eucalyptus steam rooms.
reviews.title: excellent..perfect end to a graduation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second night were were there the hospitality staff snuck a chilled bottle of wine and a coral reef made of white chocolate and truffles into our room to say Happy Honeymoon. Is was super sweet. We took full advantage of the concierge lounge while we were there and would recommend spending the little bit extra to have access. We had breakfast there every morning and the staff in there is SO GREAT! They gave a recommendations for plans for the day and had a great spread out whenever you stopped in.
reviews.title: Great location, impeccable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel a little to far for LA. The staff was lovely and rooms very clean. Pleasant stay and would go bsck if i needed to be in Santa Monica but not LA
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Marina del Rey for a wedding. When my husband booked the room, the receptionist failed to give us the special wedding rate. I had to inform the receptionist that guests of the wedding had a special price, where the receptionist adjusted the price.
reviews.title: Ritz-Carlton by name, not by service

reviews.text: Our room was clean and had a fabulous view of the marina. However, the view was the only benefit of staying in the Ritz. The walls were really thin as we could hear the neighboring room's radio and TV as if it we were in the same room. After a while of waiting for the noise to die down, we called the front desk to complain. Nothing was done, we waited an hour, called again, waited another hour and finally at 3 am, my husband went to knock on their door. The noise stopped immediately.
reviews.title: Sadly morphing into an airport hotel-Disappointing

reviews.text: When we checked out at the front desk, another receptionist had failed to inform me that I had received a delivery. When I called the third party to ask of the delivery on the way home, they mentioned that the delivery had been made the previous night, and left at the front desk in my name. I had to drive back to the hotel to retrieve it. On the delivery was a note that read, "Delivery to room 809". We did not place a "Do Not Distrub" Sign anticipating the delivery.
reviews.title: the service here is just unbeatable. the hotel is just a pleasure to stay in

reviews.text: While the location of the Ritz along the marina is nice and their pool pleasant, the service of the staff was abysmal. We tried to pre-order food and was told we could not order food the day before, only the day of. Then, we had to call several times (in the span of several hours) to have food delivered to our room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...but not up to Ritz standards
